task.title: Export Time for Payroll - Integrated
task.shortdesc: The Time payroll export can be integrated to Payroll, eliminating the need to download and re-upload a CSV file.

step.cmd: Check that the Integrated Payroll Export is enabled.

substep.cmd: Go to the Company Preferences page (Settings > Company Preferences) and ensure this option is set to Yes.
If you had to change this option from No to Yes, then you will need to open a support case via the Customer Success Portal to have the service account information added.

step.info: You can also enable or disable the CSV export option. Now you are ready to export time to Payroll.

step.cmd: From the navigation pane, select Payroll Export.
Select the pay group and pay period duration, which defaults to the most recent pay period.
Select Send to Payroll at the top of the page and confirm.

Select the Results tab to confirm that the export was successful. If the export is still in progress, select Refresh to update the status. If the export was unsuccessful, you can troubleshoot by viewing the information in the Error column.
step.info: The API export cannot be rerun; however, the export can be generated to CSV for import to pay by selecting the icon in the Download column.

As part of the time clock import process, employees are identified if they were dropped and their records were not imported. This identification helps to reconcile time and attendance information, which makes payroll processing more efficient.

When Time information is imported into Payroll, employee records are identified as not imported in two scenarios:
An employee is not in a selected pay group for time clock import but is included in the file processed for the other pay groups.
An employee was transferred out of a pay group selected for time clock import.

Payroll administrators can view a unique identifier (error code PAYG) and the session time for each record in a time clock import file. This information can be printed or exported to Microsoft Excel or CSV for reconciliation.
